alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 12:31AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Gusty winds and warmer weather coming to the Central and Eastern Interior today... Strong east winds and blowing snow will develop over Steese, Elliott and Dalton Highway Summits early this morning and continue into tonight. East winds will increase to 30 to 40 mph with gusts to 50 mph over the Dalton Highway, causing drifting snow over summits. Temperatures in these areas will rise well above zero thus wind chills will not be severe. Fairbanks will see temperatures rising late tonight through the day on Sunday, along with east winds of 15 to 20 mph. Areas near the Alaska Range, such as Delta Junction and Healy, will see moderate Chinook winds developing tonight and continuing into Sunday. South to east winds will gust to 50 mph along the Alaska Range Sunday, with temperatures rising into the 20s and 30s. Winter Weather Advisories are in effect for the Dalton and Elliott Highway summits and a Wind Advisory is in effect for the Delta Junction area. Please see those statements for additional details.
